Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
I was just wondering about something...I know there are DEX exchanges like Barterdex, Zaddex and Tortuga coming. But I think they are all using systems where a buyer needs to go to a seller directly.
But does the Komodo ecosystem have something like Ethereum has with Uniswap?
I think it's super cool that they have "pools" and anybody can create one with an ERC20 token and even earn interest.
Would be great to have something like this for all blockchains created on Komodo.
Here's the Uniswap website:
https://uniswap.exchange

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Barterlly.io

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: It's not the same as uniswap but it's an otc desk

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
OK thanks for explaining.
What I like about Uniswap is that it works as smoothly as a centralised exchange (when you select the "market price" for example on Binance etc)... you just place an order and swap.
I also read (but not sure if that's true or not) that it's good for privacy as funds go into a pool.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: @D2D privacyalternatives.com with AtomicDEX if a buyer won't find a seller, it will create a market order, which any other buyer can see in the orders list and fill that if they see and agree it on decentralised orderbook.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Barterlly is an Escrow system, which can be compared with shapeshift.io or changelly.com
It is the only one of it's own kind to my knowledge providing Escrow Service without risk.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Barterlly and Tortuga are same backend, which plans to upgrade/change it's backend to use BarterDEX protocol eventually.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
At least Shapeshift are transparent and require KYC upfront.
I don't like Changelly and also Change Now as I read many times that they often freeze transactions even for small amounts

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: @grewalsatinder AtomicDEX is the name of the technology, or the name of an actual exchange created on Komodo?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Protocol Name: BarterDEX
Applications using this protocol: AtomicDEX, HyperDEX, BarterDEX GUI (departed UI)

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: Well, but they use changelly and changenow

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: and also Binance which is actually better

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
BarterDEX tech backend binary: `marketmaker`
MarketMaker version 1, used by: BarterDEX GUI, HyperDEX
MarketMaker version 2, used by: AtomicDEX, Planned to be used by HyperDEX

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
Changelly's backend is linked to centralised exchanges from where the coin is swapped and provided to the one using their service in exchange to the cryptocurrency they are swapping for.
Barterlly is using both ends of swapping cryptocurrencies from users alone, and so far with 0 fee.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I have used Changelly, and so far they been reliable to me, without requiring KYC.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Shapeshift don't even let me do anything without KYC after login. I hatted it ever since they moved to KYC mandatory.

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content:
But I think it's more honest the way Shapeshift do it, at least it's upfront.
Much worse when they let users upload coins, then freeze the transactions...how can they call themselves "non-custodial"

Author: D2D privacyalternatives.com#5667
Content: OK, many thanks for explaining this @grewalsatinder

Author: CyberTrucker#5260
Content: The liquid reserves being built by Verus are going to replicate the Bancor exchange protocol, which will allow users to buy and sell assets without having to match orders. It will follow a pricing formula. In some ways this could be considered a dex, since it will all be done from a wallet on the blockchain and if I understand it correctly you would have custody until the exchange takes place. @D2D privacyalternatives.com

Author: stupidfish#4113
Content: is Smart Chains the name of Antara chains or the general name of all chains built on Antara?

Author: CyberTrucker#5260
Content: Mike Toutonghi of Verus on the liquid reserves: "All the Komodo interoperability we have now should remain, and all PBaaS chains will be able to get notarized independently and interoperate with Komodo/Barterdex and all the chains that they do. The Verus reserve and liquidity protocol will actually enable any PBaaS chain that is a fractional reserve to exchange to and from Verus on the PBaaS chain itself, which will enable us to solve the front running problem inherent in decentralized trading. Each PBaaS fractional reserve chain will know its value relative to Verus, based on the same kind of pricing formula as you can see in the Bancor whitepaper, slightly modified for mineable / stakeable chains. If you want to buy any fractional reserve currency in the Verus ecosystem, you will move some Verus to that chain, and you would buy it on the chain, with no need for a counterparty, meaning you would be able to sell without a buyer and buy without a seller. If you want to sell, you would sell it on the chain and then optionally move Verus back to the Verus chain. The chain's rules, miners, and stakers control the chain's reserves, which are increased when people buy and decreased when people sell. There are other ways to increase and decrease as well. "
